00:00:00:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:00:210000.Dialogue: Watch this, it's really cool. Call Leonard Hoffstadder.

00:00:05:210000.Speaker: Howard’s phone
00:00:05:210000.Dialogue: Did you say: Call Hellen Boxlightner?

00:00:15:190000.Speaker: Howard’s phone
00:00:15:190000.Dialogue: Did you say: Call Temple Badsaidor?

00:00:42:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:42:190000.Dialogue: If we're all through playing mock the flawed technology, can we get on with Halo night? We were supposed to start at 8:00. It is now 8:06.

00:00:51:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:51:040000.Dialogue: First we have to decide if those lost six minutes will be coming out of game time, bathroom time or the pizza break.

00:00:56:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:56:060000.Dialogue: We could split it two, two and two.

00:00:58:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:58:060000.Dialogue: If we're having anchovies on the pizza, we can't take it out of bathroom time.

00:01:02:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:02:080000.Dialogue: Oh, what fresh hell is this?

00:01:07:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:07:210000.Dialogue: See a Penny, pick her up, and all the day you'll have good luck.

00:01:16:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:16:120000.Dialogue: Can I hide out here for a while?

00:01:19:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:19:190000.Dialogue: There's this girl I know from back in Nebraska, Christy. She called me up, and she's like, Hey, how's California? And I'm like, Awesome, 'cause, you know, it's not Nebraska. And the next thing I know she's invited herself out here to stay with me.

00:01:34:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:34:170000.Dialogue: Anyway, she got here today and she's just been in my apartment yakity yakking about every guy she slept with in Omaha, which is basically every guy in Omaha, and washing the sluttiest collection of underwear you have ever seen in my bathroom sink.

00:01:46:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:46:050000.Dialogue: Is she doing it one thong at a time, or does she throw it all in...

00:01:54:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:54:060000.Dialogue: He really needs to dial it down.

00:01:58:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:58:080000.Dialogue: So if you don't like this Christy, why are you letting her stay?

00:02:01:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:01:040000.Dialogue: She was engaged to my cousin while she was sleeping with my brother, so she's kind of family.

00:02:07:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:07:120000.Dialogue: I apologize for my earlier outburst. Who needs Halo, when we can be regaled with the delightfully folksy tale of the Whore of Omaha?

00:02:16:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:16:060000.Dialogue: I don't think she's a whore.

00:02:17:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:17:220000.Dialogue: No, yeah, she's definitely a whore. I mean, she has absolutely no standards. This one time she was at... Where's Howard?

00:02:26:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:26:030000.Dialogue: Bonjour, mademoiselle. I understand you're new in town.

00:03:01:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:01:230000.Dialogue: I cannot believe Christy let Howard into my apartment.

00:03:06:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:06:150000.Dialogue: And I cannot believe people pay for horoscopes, but on a more serious note, it's 8:13 and we're still not playing Halo.

00:03:13:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:13:200000.Dialogue: Fine. We'll just play one-on-one until he gets back.

00:03:16:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:16:120000.Dialogue: One-on-one? We don't play one-on-one. We play teams, not one-on-one. One-on-one.

00:03:22:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:22:200000.Dialogue: The only way we can play teams at this point is if we cut Raj in half.

00:03:27:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:27:040000.Dialogue: Sure, cut the foreigner in half. There's a billion more where he came from.

00:03:31:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:31:230000.Dialogue: If you guys need a fourth, I'll play.

00:03:37:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:37:060000.Dialogue: The wheel was a great idea,

00:03:40:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:40:090000.Dialogue: relativity was a great idea. This is a notion, and a rather sucky one at that.

00:03:51:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:51:060000.Dialogue: This is a complex battle simulation with a steep learning curve. There are myriad weapons, vehicles and strategies to master, not to mention an extremely intricate backstory.

00:04:00:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:00:210000.Dialogue: Oh cool. Whose head did I just blow off?

00:04:06:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:06:160000.Dialogue: Okay, I got this. Lock and load, boys.

00:04:10:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:10:130000.Dialogue: It's the only way we can play teams.

00:04:12:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:12:120000.Dialogue: Yes, but whoever's her partner will be hamstrung by her lack of experience, and not to mention the fact...

00:04:20:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:20:140000.Dialogue: It's not good sportsmanship to shoot somebody who's just re-spawned. You need to to give them a chance to... Now, come on!

00:04:26:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:26:160000.Dialogue: Raj, Raj! She's got me cornered. Cover me!

00:04:37:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:37:160000.Dialogue: Okay, that's it. I don't know how, but she is cheating. No one can be that attractive and this skilled at a video game.

00:04:44:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:44:080000.Dialogue: Wait, Sheldon, come back. You forgot something.

00:04:55:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:55:230000.Dialogue: You laugh now-- you just wait until you need tech support.

00:05:00:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:00:220000.Dialogue: Gosh, he's kind of a sore loser, isn't he?

00:05:03:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:03:100000.Dialogue: To be fair, he's also a rather unpleasant winner.

00:05:09:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:09:080000.Dialogue: We make such a good team. Maybe we could enter a couple of Halo tournaments sometime.

00:05:14:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:14:090000.Dialogue: Or we could just have a life.

00:05:17:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:17:220000.Dialogue: I guess for you that's an option.

00:05:22:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:22:070000.Dialogue: As usual, nice talking to you, Raj.

00:05:25:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:25:220000.Dialogue: What do you suppose she meant by that?

00:05:31:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:31:110000.Dialogue: And another thing-- there's a certain ethic to the game, Penny, a well- established...

00:05:42:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:42:150000.Dialogue: It's called carpal tunnel syndrome, and quite frankly you deserve it.

00:05:49:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:49:090000.Dialogue: Howard and Christy are... kind of hooking up in my bedroom.

00:05:56:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:56:160000.Dialogue: I grew up on a farm, okay? From what I heard, they're either having sex or Howard's caught in a milking machine.

00:06:04:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:04:210000.Dialogue: Do you mind if I stay here tonight?

00:06:06:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:06:190000.Dialogue: No, take the couch, or my bed. I just got new pillows. Hypo-allergenic.

00:06:14:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:14:080000.Dialogue: Hold that thought. Leonard, a moment.

00:06:20:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:20:170000.Dialogue: Let me guess. You have a problem with this.

00:06:26:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:26:160000.Dialogue: First, we don't have houseguests. Frankly, if I could afford the rent, I'd ask you to leave.

00:06:33:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:33:000000.Dialogue: Your friendship means a lot to me as well. What else?

00:06:36:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:36:030000.Dialogue: Well... our earthquake supplies. We have a two-man, two-day kit.

00:06:41:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:41:100000.Dialogue: So if there's an earthquake and the three of us are trapped here, we could be out of food by tomorrow afternoon.

00:06:48:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:48:100000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, are you suggesting that if we let Penny stay we might succumb to cannibalism?

00:06:53:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:53:000000.Dialogue: No one ever thinks it'll happen until it does.

00:06:57:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:57:130000.Dialogue: If you promise not to chew the flesh off our bones while we sleep, you can stay.

00:07:07:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:07:230000.Dialogue: It's the logical fallacy of extending someone's argument to ridiculous proportions and then criticizing the result. And I do not appreciate it.

00:07:15:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:15:190000.Dialogue: I'll get you a blanket and a pillow.

00:07:18:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:18:120000.Dialogue: Okay, since I'm obviously being ignored here,

00:07:21:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:21:150000.Dialogue: let's go over the morning schedule. I use the bathroom from 7:00 to 7:20. Plan your ablutions and bodily functions accordingly.

00:07:29:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:29:190000.Dialogue: How am I supposed to plan my bodily functions?

00:07:32:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:32:010000.Dialogue: I suggest no liquids after 11:00 p.m.

00:07:45:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:45:090000.Dialogue: Your head goes on the other end.

00:08:05:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:05:210000.Dialogue: Yes, if you use my toothbrush, I'll jump out that window.

00:08:11:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:11:060000.Dialogue: Please don't come to my funeral. Have a good night.

00:08:17:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:17:210000.Dialogue: FYI-- his toothbrush is the red one in the Plexiglas case under the UV light.

00:08:36:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:36:060000.Dialogue: It refers to the early construction of beds which featured a mattress suspended on interlocking ropes, which would occasionally... Sleep tight.

00:10:04:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:04:100000.Dialogue: Every Saturday since we've lived in this apartment I have awakened at 6:15, poured myself a bowl of cereal, added a quarter cup of two percent milk, sat on this end of this couch, turned on BBC America, and watched Doctor Who.

00:10:19:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:19:050000.Dialogue: Every Saturday since we've lived in this apartment I have awakened at 6:15, poured myself a bowl

00:10:23:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:23:180000.Dialogue: I know. You have a TV in your room. Why don't you just have breakfast in bed?

00:10:28:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:28:110000.Dialogue: Because I am neither an invalid, nor a woman celebrating Mother's Day.

00:10:42:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:42:160000.Dialogue: What the hell is your problem?

00:10:45:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:45:200000.Dialogue: Okay, this cereal has lost all its molecular integrity. I now have a bowl of shredded wheat paste.

00:10:57:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:57:200000.Dialogue: Why do you people hate sleep? Are you wearing my robe?

00:11:04:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:04:150000.Dialogue: Yeah. Sorry, I'll have it cleaned.

00:11:23:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:23:180000.Dialogue: More precisely, weused your loofah. I exfoliated her brains out.

00:11:33:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:33:150000.Dialogue: Then we'll probably need to talk about your stuffed bear collection.

00:11:43:230000.Speaker: Christie
00:11:43:230000.Dialogue: Here's my little engine that could.

00:11:50:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:50:190000.Dialogue: There's one beloved children's book I'll never read again.

00:12:03:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:03:040000.Dialogue: So, Christy, what are your plans?

00:12:05:080000.Speaker: Christie
00:12:05:080000.Dialogue: Howard said he'd take me shopping in Beverly Hills.

00:12:08:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:08:160000.Dialogue: Yeah, no, I meant plans to find someplace to live. Other than with me. Not that I don't love having you, but it's... It's a little crowded.

00:12:15:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:15:110000.Dialogue: Penny, you're always welcome to stay with us.

00:12:17:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:17:130000.Dialogue: Oh, terrific. Now we're running a cute little B & B.

00:12:21:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:21:170000.Dialogue: Let me offer a little outside-the-box thinking here. Why doesn't Christy stay with me?

00:12:30:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:30:170000.Dialogue: Then it's all settled. Christy will stay with Howard, Penny can go back to her apartment, and I'll watch the last 24 minutes of Doctor Who. Although at this point, it's more like Doctor Why Bother?

00:12:46:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:46:000000.Dialogue: So what do you say? Want to repair to Casa Wolowitz?

00:12:49:190000.Speaker: Christie
00:12:49:190000.Dialogue: What is that, like a Mexican deli?

00:12:52:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:52:130000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, I should have mentioned this earlier. My last name is Wolowitz.

00:12:58:020000.Speaker: Christie
00:12:58:020000.Dialogue: That's so cool. My first Jew.

00:13:04:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:04:200000.Dialogue: I imagine there aren't very many Kosher Cornhuskers.

00:13:10:120000.Speaker: Christie
00:13:10:120000.Dialogue: But you're still taking me shopping?

00:13:13:120000.Speaker: Christie
00:13:13:120000.Dialogue: Okay, I'll go pack my stuff.

00:13:18:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:18:090000.Dialogue: When they perfect human cloning, I'm going to order 12 of those.

00:13:24:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:24:040000.Dialogue: Can't you see she's using you?

00:13:26:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:26:010000.Dialogue: Who cares? Last night, she pulled off her blouse and I wept.

00:13:29:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:29:210000.Dialogue: I know her. Okay? She'll have sex with anyone, as long as they keep buying her things.

00:13:40:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:40:170000.Dialogue: If you'll excuse me, I have some Bar Mitzvah bonds to cash.

00:13:53:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:53:030000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, we cannot do this without Wolowitz.

00:13:56:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:56:130000.Dialogue: We can't order Chinese food without Wolowitz?

00:13:59:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:59:130000.Dialogue: Let me walk you through it. Our standard order is: the steamed dumpling appetizer, General Tso's chicken, beef with broccoli, shrimp with lobster sauce and vegetable lo mein. Do you see the problem?

00:14:14:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:14:030000.Dialogue: Our entire order is predicated on four dumplings and four entrees divided amongst four people.

00:14:22:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:22:100000.Dialogue: So, we'll just order three entrees.

00:14:27:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:27:200000.Dialogue: We could cut it into thirds.

00:14:29:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:29:090000.Dialogue: Then it's no longer a dumpling. Once you cut it open it is, at best, a very small open-faced sandwich.

00:14:35:120000.Speaker: Waiter
00:14:35:120000.Dialogue: Hi, fellas. Where's your annoying little friend who thinks he speaks Mandarin?

00:14:41:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:41:120000.Dialogue: He's putting his needs ahead of the collective good. Where he comes from, that's punishable by death.

00:14:53:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:53:110000.Dialogue: Can we get an order of dumplings but with three instead of four?

00:14:58:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:58:040000.Dialogue: This isn't a substitution. It's a reduction.

00:15:08:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:08:230000.Dialogue: If we fill up on dumplings, we need to eliminate another entree.

00:15:14:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:14:170000.Dialogue: If we have extra, we'll just take the leftovers home.

00:15:16:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:16:220000.Dialogue: And divide it how? I'm telling you, we cannot do this without Wolowitz.

00:15:20:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:20:140000.Dialogue: Wolowitz is with his new girlfriend. If you had let me invite Penny, then you would have had your fourth.

00:15:25:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:25:010000.Dialogue: Have you seen Penny eat Chinese food? She uses a fork and she double-dips her egg rolls.

00:15:29:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:29:230000.Dialogue: Exactly but we'd have to if she was here!

00:15:33:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:33:110000.Dialogue: Can we please make a decision? Not only are there children starving in India, there's an Indian starving right here.

00:15:40:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:40:230000.Dialogue: There's an idea. Why don't we just go out for Indian food?

00:15:45:120000.Speaker: Waiter
00:15:45:120000.Dialogue: You're nice boys. Tell you what I'm going to do. I'm going to bring you the four dumplings. When I'm walking over to the table, maybe I get bumped, one of the dumplings fall to the floor. No one has to know.

00:16:05:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:05:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, we can always divide soup.

00:16:25:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:25:180000.Dialogue: With Wolowitz spending all of his time with your friend Christy...

00:16:28:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:28:220000.Dialogue: She's not my friend. Friends do not get their friends' Care Bears all sweaty.

00:16:33:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:33:210000.Dialogue: Right. Anyway, uh, with Wolowitz occupied elsewhere, we had something we wanted to ask you.

00:16:41:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:41:050000.Dialogue: Yes. We would very much appreciate it if you would be the fourth member of our Halo team. I don't think I need to tell you what an honor this is.

00:16:57:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:57:190000.Dialogue: That's so sweet, but I'm going out dancing with a girlfriend.

00:17:01:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:01:080000.Dialogue: You can't go out; it's Halo night.

00:17:04:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:04:110000.Dialogue: Well, for Penny, it's dancing night.

00:17:11:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:11:210000.Dialogue: Why don't I play with you guys tomorrow?

00:17:13:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:13:180000.Dialogue: Tonight is Halo night. It's like talking to a wall.

00:17:18:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:18:040000.Dialogue: All right, now, Sheldon, you and I are about to have a problem.

00:17:25:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:25:230000.Dialogue: Yes, but you didn't portray her as completely irrational.

00:17:29:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:29:070000.Dialogue: All right, fellas, I gotta go. But good luck.

00:17:36:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:36:020000.Dialogue: Maybe we should've asked if we could go dancing with her and her girlfriend.

00:17:39:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:39:190000.Dialogue: Assuming we could dance-- which we can't-- there are three of us and two of them.

00:17:45:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:45:070000.Dialogue: It's the Chinese restaurant all over again.

00:17:48:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:48:160000.Dialogue: I assure you that cutting a dumpling in thirds is child's play compared with three men each attempting to dance with 67% of a woman.

00:17:57:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:57:090000.Dialogue: For God's sakes, Sheldon, you're driving me crazy!

00:18:00:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:00:220000.Dialogue: Your anger is not with me, sir, but with basic mathematics.

00:18:03:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:03:100000.Dialogue: I'm pretty sure my anger is with you.

00:18:05:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:05:040000.Dialogue: What's happening to us? We're falling apart.

00:18:18:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:18:120000.Dialogue: We can't get to the phone right now because we're having sex!

00:18:24:050000.Speaker: Christie
00:18:24:050000.Dialogue: You're not going to put that on your message, are you?

00:18:26:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:26:150000.Dialogue: Nah, I'm just kidding. I'll re-record it.

00:18:32:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:32:130000.Dialogue: Sheldon, think this through. You're going to ask Howard to choose between sex and Halo.

00:18:37:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:37:030000.Dialogue: No, I'm going to ask him to choose between sex and Halo Three.

00:18:41:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:41:060000.Dialogue: As far as I know, sex has not been upgraded to include Hi-Def graphics and enhanced weapon systems.

00:18:46:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:46:180000.Dialogue: You're right, all sex has is nudity, orgasms and human contact.

00:18:54:010000.Speaker: Christie
00:18:54:010000.Dialogue: You can take the damn plastic off the couch once in a while!

00:18:57:040000.Speaker: Howard's Mother
00:18:57:040000.Dialogue: Why, so you and Howard can hump on it?!

00:19:01:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:01:030000.Dialogue: Ladies, ladies, I'm sure there's a middle ground.

00:19:06:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:06:070000.Dialogue: You guys talk. I'm gonna take my scooter out for a little spin.

00:19:09:100000.Speaker: Christie
00:19:09:100000.Dialogue: You happy? You drove your own son out of the house.

00:19:17:020000.Speaker: Howard's Mother
00:19:17:020000.Dialogue: He's not a man, he's a putz! And don't you take that tone with me, you gold digger!

00:19:23:030000.Speaker: Howard's Mother
00:19:23:030000.Dialogue: And I'll tell you something else, you're barking up the wrong tree.

00:19:26:080000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:19:26:080000.Dialogue: 'Cause as long as you're around, Howard is out of the will!

00:19:29:130000.Speaker: Christie
00:19:29:130000.Dialogue: You know what? I got better offers. I'm outta here.

00:19:33:010000.Speaker: Howard's Mother
00:19:33:010000.Dialogue: That's right. Go back to Babylon, you whore!

00:19:43:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:43:230000.Dialogue: I thought she was the whore of Omaha.

00:19:52:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:52:050000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you got him in your sights! Fire! He's charging his plasma rifle!

00:19:55:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:55:180000.Dialogue: I can't shoot now. I'm cloaking!

00:20:00:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:00:000000.Dialogue: That's why they call it cloaking, dead man!

00:20:05:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:05:220000.Dialogue: Hey, guys. My friends and I got tired of dancing, so we came over to have sex with you.

00:20:16:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:16:000000.Dialogue: Son of a bitch. Med pack! I need a med pack!

00:20:22:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:22:130000.Dialogue: There's a sniper. Use your rocket launcher!

00:20:24:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:20:24:130000.Dialogue: All I've got is a Needler and I'm all out of ammo!

00:20:27:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:27:020000.Dialogue: And now you're out of life. Why'd you hit pause?
